results.title: Natural language learning
results.brief_description: A look at the natural language or whole language approach to the learning of language in the early years of school. This approach is based on the assumption that literacy develops naturally through the use of language as a whole, such as learning to read to follow directions, for information, and to find out about the world. This video also deals with assessment and evaluation and is a good memory jogger for teaches and consultants.

results.title: Natural childbirth at home
results.brief_description: Midwives, child-birth educators and families will find an entire Early Pregnancy Class in this wonderful video. Although it primarily addresses preparation for home-birth, all pregnant women will find it reassuring, confidence building and informative.

results.title: Natsik hunting
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Wolf Koenig, Peter Raymont and Mosha Michael
results.brief_description: Natsik Hunting is the story of a seal hunt. It is also the first live-action film shot and directed by an Inuk. Initial shot by 25 year-old Mosha Michael on Super 8mm and converted to 16mm by NFBC.

results.title: Native trees of Stradbroke Island: pandanus pedunculatus
results.brief_description: A aesthetic piece set to music about the Pandanus pedunculatus, a species of native tree growing on Stradbroke Island, Queensland with cries of currawongs, magpies and crows in the background. No commentary.

results.title: Native Tongue – Mo’Ju
results.credit_line: ℗ 2018 Mojo Juju, exclusively licensed to Australian Broadcasting Corporation. (de Luzuriaga / Ma / Seumanutafa)
results.brief_description: Deceptively simple, Mo’Ju’s ‘Native Tongue’ it uses a single shot of the singer and three Djuki Mala dancers walking through an unmistakably Australian landscape. The glitch effect utilised not only adds visual emphasis to the on-screen movement, but also underlines the poignant lyrics.

constellations_primary.name: Native Tongue
constellations_primary.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

results.description: The lead single off their album of the same name, Native Tongue (2018) saw artist Mo’Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals. The glitch effect utilised not only adds visual emphasis to the on-screen movement, but also underlines the poignant lyrics.

results.title: Native bears
results.creator_credit: Keith Hutchison, Kingcroft Productions and William Horne
results.brief_description: A simple study of the life and habits of the koalas and wombats, both of which have been called native bears. They are compared with the marsupial tiger and the opossum. Presents the animals in their natural surroundings; wombats drinking at a stream; koalas feeding on gum leaves with their young in their pouches.

results.title: Native Africa
results.brief_description: Short travelogue that moves from Capetown to Victoria Falls in the Zambezi. Shows friendly natives and not-so-friendly animals. Also talks about the achievements of Cecil Rhodes and David Livingstone

results.title: National Youth Theatre
results.creator_credit: John Bloom, Melstrum Films and John Crome
results.brief_description: Young people from 110 different schools in Britain, take part in the annual National Youth Theatre production. Established in 1956, it has formed 85 other youth theatres all over Britain. Its aim is to help young people enjoy the theatre by participating in it and finding out what goes into making a play and its production. Shows rehearsals leading up to a full scale production of “Coriolanus” in the West End theatre. Some lovely footage of London in 1965.
